Reviews.Title: “Accessible, Safe and Clean”
Reviews.Author: IMpenilla
Reviews.Content: if you don't have the luxury of time, then this hostel is perfect for you. MTR station is opposite the building and the area itself is a shopping avenue. This hostel is ideal for travellers who wish to spend their time and money for the "trip" and not for their sleep. At first, we were disappointed with the builing because of these shops runned by Indians and Pakistans, but then we realised they're friendly and the hostel is totally safe after all. Rooms are very small but clean, good enough to have a decent sleep.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: robert y
Reviews.Content: If yu need a safe and clean place to stay, mapleleaf hostel is the best choice. This was my first time staying in Chungking, but based on previous reviews, I felt confident staying at the Maple Leaf. I was pleasantly surprised - the rooms were basic but very clean, there was plenty of hot water for the shower, the bed was comfortable enough, and I slept well. There was no outside noise.They were able to store my luggage after checkout until my flight in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Hernita Y
Reviews.Content: The hostel location wasn't really good and wasn't really clean. Even though the location is closed with shopping centre, but I wasn't really satisfied. The hostel, is inside of big building whiches has so many cell phone shops. But the hostel room, is clean and the crew is friendly, but these place is not really recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice and helpful staff, wonderful place,”
Reviews.Author: mary c
Reviews.Content: Good place for staying a few days, clean and safe, very helpful staff, definite come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Oj L
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a 5-star accommodation in HK with the very affordable price that Maple Leaf Guest House offers, then this is not the place for you. Maple Leaf is best for budget travelers who won't mind the size of a room as long as it's clean and you can sleep. The lodging is located on the 11th and 12th floors of Block E in Chung King Mansions where there are many similar accommodations. While at first, the multicultural stores and businesses you would see at the ground floor would give you second thoughts, the building is safe, albeit not very clean. What I like about Maple Leaf is that their land lady/administrator named Lee is very helpful and friendly. She speaks English too so no guessing when you talk to her. Their rooms are HK-style apartment-small but the one I stayed in was very clean and air-conditioning was really cold. I would have wanted the shower heater to work seamlessly but it has to be pre-bath turned on so you can get that hot shower. Also, you have to be careful about your TV's volume (and any other volume of bedroom activities) since they can be audible from the outside. I love that they have free Wi-Fi, water, and tissue! Over-all, I would say, I was satisfied with my personal stay in HK because of Maple Leaf; very accessible and just right for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we thought!!!”
Reviews.Author: julien B
Reviews.Content: stayed 8night in maple leaf hong kong, at first when we arrived we were told that we booked a room with no windows(which we did not know as when we booked no one mentioned it) so after we paid an extra 700hk dollars (£60,€80) we discovered the room, tiny, but at first sight it looked allright. unfortunatly after 10mn we just noticed that the floor was covered with hair and body hair, the bed sheet were smelling and worst when we moved the bed we found a ton of dust(it might have not been cleaned in the last 10month), the toilet sit and the all toilet were covered with pee(see the pics) and cherry on the top of the cake wi fi is really bad at night, chungking mansion is not scary its ok but this place it is, for the same price (460hk$ per night) we could have found better place than this, a little hotel not an hostel surounded by drug dealers(as peope smoke crack on the stairs) we also bought some ticket to ocean park,the lady/owner sold them for 260hk$ when we found them for 250hk$ at other places and she mentioned that it wont be any queue with those ones as we gonna be able to jump it, it was false she lied as their is no fast ticket available for the park!!! towel were not cleaned and smelly, when we mentioned it she looked upset and changed them saying that it was fresh ones (maybe but not well tho i would say). we also slept at a friend place one night and on the morning when we came back we were expecting the room to be cleaned but it hasnt !!! we ve been travelling asia for 3month now and didnt not stayed in 5stars hotel, but even in mainland china we had better place and cleanest place than that, it has been such a disapointment, I really hope they will improve the quality of their services, as their price is quiet high they have to give what people pay for, and looking at previous coments,i did not have toothbrush or even soap!!!I really hope this comment will help people but honestly i would not recommand this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: Heiress7
Reviews.Content: The directions given by the hostel were great. The main floor is nothing to be concerned about its busy, loud and full of people trying to sell you stuff. The room was tiny (thats the norm in HK) but very clean. The bed was comfy, there was a/c, tv and your own bathroom. They advertise hot showers 24 hours but the hot water for your shower lasts about 5 minutes. The staff were friendly and full of information, the floor felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for single traveler with easy airport access”
Reviews.Author: tuco919
Reviews.Content: Had a long airport layover so I stayed one night here. Yes the room was tiny but spotless and felt cozy and safe. Do not worry too much about the united nations on the first floor, just know where you are going or ask directions. Someone walked me right to the correct elevator. I checked in and was in my room in no time. The next morning I left CGM crossed the street and got on the cheap but clean double decker bus to the airport. All in all a perfect overnight mini adventure layover.

Reviews.Title: “Nice guesthouse, cheap with great location.”
Reviews.Author: azrul
Reviews.Content: Chung King Mansion where Maple Leaf is located is in the centre of the city, next to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. The people at the entrance may looks intimidating but just say no and they will not bother you. The room : small (HK standard) but very clean with WIFI connection. Flat Screen TV with multiple channels. Bed was good but little bit hard. The bathroom is clean with hot shower. Good enough for both of us. Stay here for 3 nights. No complaint. Good hostel with great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ben77777
Reviews.Content: The building is located in the center of the city, next to subway, but the entrance level is a multicultural market which can be scary. Print the guesthouse details to be able to find it as the building is large with a few different staircases. After passing the common area of the building the room is a nice surprise: small (HK standard) but very clean, nice WIFI connection. It's not a hostel, so don't expect common area. From the airport - if you are not in hurry - you may take the direct bus. The best choice if you are on a budget trip and you want a private room.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and great location”
Reviews.Author: wonderingtraveller80
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Hong Kong, and decided to rest my tired head here. The room i was staying in, was not the largest but that did not concern me, cause the room was clean, had a fan, ac unit, shower with hot running water and tv. Did not watch the tv at all. The guest housr also had wifi. The staff where friendly and very helpful, in terms of telling me about the sights and also places to eat and dishes to try!! In terms of location, it is on Nathan rd, with is a busy and lively road. A short walk and you are at Star perry, in time to watch the light show and it is also near public transport. I found the guest house to be safe and clean. Safe because of the reputation Chung king mansion has. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine and affordable guest house in the heart of Kowloon!”
Reviews.Author: dbailey62Toronto
Reviews.Content: Some reviews made me apprehensive about booking the Maple Leaf Guest House in the Chung King Mansions but my four nights there were very fine. Yes, the CKM has a reputation but my experience in no way was negative. The location is superb. It is only a short walk to the Star Ferry pier with the bus from the airport stopping right in front of the building. Equally convenient is the subway. The Tsim Sha Tsui station is but steps from the entrance on Nathan. For those who fear the touts, there really is nothing to fear. Just walk with conviction, say "no thank you" if they attempt to divert you to a different establishment and maintain your civility. All will be well. I did purchase a SIM card immediately upon my arrival and that propreitor pointed me in the direction of elevator E and presto, I was on the 12th floor and being greeted by the very courteous Miss Lee. Regarding the rooms, I stayed in a single. The rooms was quite small but impeccably clean with tile covering the floor and all walls (much more easily cleaned than carpet). The bed was a single but more than adequate for yours truly. The room had no windows but that didn't bother me as I was there only to sleep after a long day of seeing the sites. The room had an effective air conditioner, television set, telephone and a variety of AC plugs including the U-ground of North America that I required. The washroom .... yes, you have a private washroom ... was small and was really just a large shower stall in which was situated a a toilet and sink. The water heater was of the tankless type that you turned on about 30 seconds before you began your shower and turned off when finished. The only trick is ensuring that you did all your "business" before your shower so as to avoid wet feet but hey, it all works. Their are a pair of elevators for each tower in the Chung King Mansions. One elevator handles even numbered floors, the other the odd numbered floors. There are of course stairs as well so you can take the other elevator and walk up or down one flight if you so choose. There is plenty of shopping on the ground floor of the CKM. It can be a bit intimidating but it can also be a lot of fun. Many food choices too although as I was eating on my adventures, I usually only bought a few vegi samosas, from a vendor by my elevator, for a late snack up in my room. So, in conclusion, if you need only a sleeping space and are looking for a nice price, this establishment should suit you well. My only regret is that I stayed in HK for only four nights. I should have done seven. If and when I return to HK for a part two of my explorations, I will certainly consider this establishment depending on just what my requirements might be at the time. I would also have no problem recommending it to any budget travellers that need a clean and convenient place to stay. db

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, safe and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Anfisa55
Reviews.Content: Chunking Mansions aside, the guest house is very clean and safe. The owner is very helpful, we got a free map, free hot and cold water. There was a lock and a chain on the door, plus a locked door into the guesthouse. Wifi and cable tv in the room, which was cleaned every day and was spotless. A bit small but that's Hong Kong. Price was a bit high but that's because there was a convention in the city. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Little Heaven in Chungking Mansion”
Reviews.Author: Gulali56
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed there for 5 nights in early Oct 2011,yes it's very small even for a petite girls like us. But hey,it's Hong kong,when space is limited and expensive, so yes we are very fortunate we have a small frame so we fit nicely with this hostel.For us the important things is clean bed and bathroom. They clean the room and change the towel everyday. We can refill our mineral water for free and the owner is very helpful and friendly. The free wifi is a bit sucks, maybe because my room is a bit far from their front desk.*sigh* And the chungking mansion itself is a bit scary if you are a girl traveler. Had a scary moment with some Indian and African men who were following us because they know we only 2girls traveler,but thanks God there's a cctv camera inside the lift and once we arrived in our floor we were okay and safe. My opinion is do not make eye contact to them and always keep the number of the owner for emergency :( But as I said before this hostel is very good but as for Chungking mansion as long as you have male friend with you then this place is very recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Services from the Owner”
Reviews.Author: Aris T
Reviews.Content: Actually I was bit doubt when my friend said that not to book any hostel in Chungking Mansions since there are many touts around there. I was planning to revise it but I turn it down since I thought that I would give it a try. We were arrived in Hong Kong at midnight and I was quite feared that our experience in Agra, India would happen again. Surrounded by touts and etc. But I found that the touts around chungking mansion are OK since they won't disturb you if you already said no. Tips that you should do are pretending that you were already knew where to go, so they won't bother you a lot. Suddenly there was an old woman approaching me, I thought that she would be another tout so I pretend not to be interested, but she is holding my friend's name (who made the booking in this guest house). I finally found it later that she is the owner of the guest house. She said that she has been waiting for us since she was worried that we would get lost and we didn't call her yet. She's very friendy and helpful. We felt that we are suddenly felt in safe hands for that night. We also found that Baba (who is in the reception) was very helpful too and friendly. The room is small for three persons, but hey...this is Hong Kong, most of the rooms are small unless you would like to pay extra (vagant) for rooms, you would have big size ones. The bathroom is small but clean. There's also complimentary Wi-Fi in the room which is very helpful for us to connect to the wired world. The location is very good, near to Tsim Tsa Sui (sorry if it's mistakenly spelled) Station, near to the McDonald's, Pizza Hut, Seven Eleven so you would find it helpful to get a food. In overall, I would highly recommend this guest house since the location is very good and has excellent services.

Reviews.Title: “Good hostel in Chungking Mansions.”
Reviews.Author: dromack
Reviews.Content: Hostel inside the building Chungking Mansions. The room was very clean but very small for three people. Equipped with a bathroom, also very small. Free internet in the room. Staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a very good starting point for shopping and exploring the city. The room rate is very low (about Euros 10 per person per day).

HotelInfo.Name: Maple Leaf Guest House
HotelInfo.Address: E4, Block E, 12nd Floor, Chung King Mansions, 36-44 Nathan Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
